name: Amr Mohammed
summary: Aspiring Machine Learning Engineer with a solid foundation in data structures and algorithms, object-oriented programming, and version control using Git. Eager to apply knowledge of Python, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn to develop intelligent solutions and contribute to real-world machine learning projects.

skills.technologies: Python, C++, C#, SQL, Dart, HTML
TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Keras, ONNX, Reinforcement Learning
Data Structures, Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn, PySpark, Jupyter Notebook
Flask, REST APIs, Gemini API, GitHub API, HTML, CSS
Git, Linux, OOP, Agile, Modular Architecture, SDLC

experience.title: AI Internship
experience.responsibilities:
Developing a full-stack web app to transform resumes and online profiles into ATS-compliant CVs using the Gemini LLM API and NLP.
Building a real-time content editor with PDF export, leveraging Flask, PyMuPDF, and a modular architecture.
Created a mobile app that identifies products from images using MobileNet with 99% accuracy.
Built a hybrid recommendation system combining content-based filtering (Sentence-BERT) and collaborative filtering (LightFM) to suggest local alternatives.
Developed a Unity game where difficulty adapts to player performance using reinforcement learning.
Integrated an ONNX model that adjusts speed and obstacles in real-time based on player score.

education.achievements:
Cumulative Grade: B, GP: A
Coursework: Introduction to Machine Learning, Data Science, Neural Network

projects.name: AI-Powered Resume Builder
projects.description: Developing a full-stack web application using Flask and the Gemini API to transform resumes and online profiles into ATS-compliant CVs, focusing on NLP techniques to optimize content.

projects.name: Local Product Finder (GP)
projects.description: Built a hybrid recommendation system combining content-based filtering (Sentence-BERT) and collaborative filtering (LightFM) to suggest local alternatives, enhancing user experience through personalized suggestions.

projects.name: AlphaLearn Game
projects.description: Developed a Unity game where difficulty adapts to player performance using reinforcement learning, integrating an ONNX model to adjust speed and obstacles in real-time based on player score.

projects.name: Cancer-prediction
projects.description: Implemented machine learning models in a Jupyter Notebook to classify breast cancer tumors as malignant or benign based on features extracted from digitized images, utilizing the Breast Cancer Wisconsin (Diagnostic) dataset.

certificates.name: Mathematics for Machine Learning
certificates.description: Completed a course focused on the mathematical foundations required for machine learning. Gained proficiency in linear algebra, calculus, and probability.

certificates.name: CS50’s Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python
certificates.description: Completed Harvard's CS50 AI course, learning fundamental AI concepts using Python. Explored search algorithms, machine learning, and knowledge representation.

certificates.name: CS50: Introduction to Computer Science
certificates.description: Completed Harvard's CS50 course, gaining a solid foundation in computer science principles. Covered topics such as data structures, algorithms, and software engineering.
